You watch as the group grows into a vibrant community. </p> <p> Your efforts help create a supportive environment that nurtures the next generation of women in technology. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Mentoring circles have been shown to increase retention and success rates for women in STEM fields.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Mar Hicks, "Programmed Inequality"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Organize a conference for mentoring groups->Ava Scene 8AW]]</li> <li>[[Publish a guide on creating effective mentoring programs->Ava Scene 8AX]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7Z --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Audio Memoir</h2> <p> You decide to record an audiobook version of your memoir, bringing your story to life with your own voice. The recordings are shared widely, reaching audiences who prefer listening over reading. </p> <p> Listeners write to thank you for the personal touch, saying your voice made the history feel immediate and real. You receive invitations to narrate other women’s stories as well. </p> <p> Your audio memoir becomes a powerful tool for education and inspiration, ensuring your legacy resonates across generations. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Audio memoirs and podcasts have become popular mediums for sharing women’s stories in STEM.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: eniacprogrammers.org; Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Create a podcast series on women in computing->Ava Scene 8AY]]</li> <li>[[Collaborate with educators to use your audio memoir in classrooms->Ava Scene 8AZ]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AA --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Launching a Math Club</h2> <p> Inspired by your outreach, you start a math club at the library. Children from all backgrounds gather to solve puzzles, learn about famous women mathematicians, and experiment with hands-on projects. You invite guest speakers—engineers, programmers, and scientists—to share their journeys. </p> <p> The club becomes a safe space for curiosity and creativity. You notice shy students gaining confidence, and girls who once doubted their abilities now lead group activities and help others. </p> <p> As the club grows, you realize you’re not just teaching math—you’re helping to build a new generation of trailblazers, just like Edith Clarke, Ada Lovelace, and Katherine Johnson. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Community-based STEM clubs and mentorship programs have been shown to increase girls’ participation and confidence in math and science.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: iD Tech; Resource Options; NSF</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Expand the club to include coding and robotics->Ava Scene 8BA]]</li> <li>[[Organize a city-wide math competition->Ava Scene 8BB]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AB --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Children’s Book Author</h2> <p> You write and publish a children’s book about early computers and the women who built them. The story follows a curious girl who dreams of becoming an inventor, inspired by real figures like Ada Lovelace and Grace Hopper. </p> <p> The book is picked up by local schools and libraries. Teachers use it to spark discussions about perseverance, creativity, and the importance of representation in STEM. </p> <p> Parents tell you their children now see scientists and engineers as heroes, and you realize you’re helping to change the narrative for a new generation. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Children’s books about women in STEM help challenge stereotypes and inspire girls to pursue science and technology careers.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: iD Tech; Kids Discover</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a reading at a local school->Ava Scene 8BC]]</li> <li>[[Collaborate with illustrators to create a STEM comic series->Ava Scene 8BD]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AC --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Mentorship Program</h2> <p> You help launch a mentorship program for women in technology, connecting students and early-career professionals with experienced mentors in STEM. The program offers workshops, networking events, and one-on-one support. </p> <p> Participants share stories of overcoming challenges, learning new skills, and building confidence. Many credit the program with helping them land their first jobs or promotions. </p> <p> You are invited to keynote the program’s annual event, where you see the ripple effect of your advocacy—more women entering, thriving, and leading in STEM fields. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Mentorship and networking programs are proven to increase retention and advancement for women in STEM.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: White House Women in STEM; Resource Options; Dow; STEM Goes Red</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Expand the program to include women of color and LGBTQ+ mentors->Ava Scene 8BE]]</li> <li>[[Develop an online mentorship platform->Ava Scene 8BF]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AD --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Anthology of Women’s Stories</h2> <p> You curate and publish an anthology of women’s stories in STEM, collecting essays, interviews, and artwork from across the country. The book is celebrated for its diversity and honesty, and quickly becomes a resource for classrooms and book clubs. </p> <p> Contributors share how writing their stories helped them process challenges and celebrate victories. Readers see themselves reflected in the pages, inspired to pursue their own dreams. </p> <p> You realize you’ve created a living legacy—a chorus of voices that will echo for generations. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Anthologies and oral history projects have helped preserve the stories of women and minorities in STEM, providing role models and inspiration.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Resource Options; Kids Discover; SHARE.org</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a launch event for the anthology->Ava Scene 8BG]]</li> <li>[[Partner with schools to use the book in their curriculum->Ava Scene 8BH]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AE --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Publishing a Collection of Letters</h2> <p> You compile your letters of encouragement into a published collection, adding reflections and stories from the women you’ve mentored. The book is distributed to schools, libraries, and STEM organizations. </p> <p> Readers are moved by the honesty and warmth in your words. Educators use the collection to spark conversations about perseverance, mentorship, and the importance of community. </p> <p> Your letters become a beacon of hope and guidance for women and girls facing their own challenges in STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Collections of letters and personal stories are increasingly used in STEM education to foster resilience and connection.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: White House Women in STEM; Resource Options; STEM Goes Red</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Record an audiobook version of your letters->Ava Scene 8BI]]</li> <li>[[Launch a letter-writing campaign for International Women’s Day->Ava Scene 8BJ]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AF --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Mentorship Chain</h2> <p> You encourage your mentees to write their own letters, creating a mentorship chain that stretches across generations. Each new writer adds her story, advice, and encouragement, forming a living document of support. </p> <p> The chain grows, connecting women in STEM from around the world. You watch as new leaders emerge, inspired by the wisdom and kindness passed down through the letters. </p> <p> Your simple act of writing has become a movement, empowering countless women to find their voices and lift each other up. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Peer mentorship and intergenerational storytelling are proven strategies for building confidence and resilience among women in STEM.<br> <span style="font-style: italic;">Source: White House Women in STEM; Resource Options; STEM Goes Red; SHARE.org</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Publish the mentorship chain online->Ava Scene 8BK]]</li> <li>[[Present the project at a women’s leadership summit->Ava Scene 8BL]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AG --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Advocacy Panel</h2> <p> You join a panel at a national conference to discuss the future of women in tech. The room is filled with students, professionals, and educators eager to learn from your experiences. You share insights on overcoming barriers, the value of mentorship, and the importance of community. </p> <p> The discussion is lively and inspiring. You connect with other advocates and leave with new ideas for supporting women in STEM. After the event, several attendees approach you to thank you for your candor and encouragement. </p> <p> You realize that sharing your story and strategies publicly is a powerful way to create lasting change in the tech world. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Advocacy panels and conferences help amplify women’s voices in STEM and foster networks that drive policy and cultural change. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM Mentorship Program; Million Women Mentors</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Help organize a mentorship summit for women in STEM->Ava Scene 8BA]]</li> <li>[[Publish your panel talk as an article->Ava Scene 8BB]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AH --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Encouraging Hidden Histories</h2> <p> You encourage others at the conference to share their own hidden histories. Some attendees are hesitant, unsure if their stories matter, but your encouragement gives them the confidence to speak up. </p> <p> As more voices join the conversation, you see the narrative of computing history expand and diversify. You help facilitate a workshop on oral history, teaching participants how to record and preserve their experiences. </p> <p> By the end of the event, you’ve helped spark a movement to ensure that no story is left untold. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Sharing hidden histories and personal narratives helps build a more inclusive and accurate record of women’s contributions in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM Mentorship Program; All Together</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Help launch a digital archive of women’s STEM stories->Ava Scene 8BC]]</li> <li>[[Mentor a group of students in oral history research->Ava Scene 8BD]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AI --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>National Oral History Project</h2> <p> You help organize a national oral history project focused on women in STEM. The project collects interviews from women across the country, capturing a rich tapestry of experiences and insights. </p> <p> The stories are archived online and in libraries, making them accessible to researchers, students, and the public. You are invited to present the project at conferences and in classrooms. </p> <p> You feel a sense of accomplishment, knowing that you’ve helped ensure these voices will be preserved for generations to come. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> National oral history projects are vital for documenting the diverse experiences of women in STEM and inspiring future generations. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM Mentorship Program; STEM for Her Mentor Program</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Partner with a museum to create a traveling exhibit->Ava Scene 8BE]]</li> <li>[[Encourage schools to use the oral histories in their curriculum->Ava Scene 8BF]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AJ --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Documentary Collaboration</h2> <p> You support a new documentary about women in computing, working closely with filmmakers to ensure the stories are accurate and authentic. The book is filled with stories, checklists, and advice from your own journey and those of your peers. </p> <p> The guidebook is adopted by advocacy groups and student organizations nationwide. You write a heartfelt letter to the archive, sharing your motivations and the journey that led you to finally step into the light. </p> <p> The archive staff is thrilled and quickly organizes a public event to honor your contribution. At the gathering, you meet researchers, students, and even families who have been inspired by your story. The community expresses gratitude for your courage and for helping to fill a crucial gap in the history of computing. </p> <p> As you speak at the event, you feel a sense of closure and pride. Your name is now officially connected to your work, ensuring your legacy will be remembered and celebrated for generations to come. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Many women in STEM have chosen to reveal their identities later in life, allowing their stories to be properly credited and inspiring others to do the same. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"; eniacprogrammers.org</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Participate in an oral history interview for the archive->Ava Scene 8BM]]</li> <li>[[Encourage other anonymous contributors to come forward->Ava Scene 8BN]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AN --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>The Power of Anonymous Legacy</h2> <p> You choose to let your story stand on its own, author unknown. The archive’s staff respects your wishes, and the collection is cited in research and referenced in documentaries as the “Anonymous ENIAC Notes.” </p> <p> Over time, scholars speculate about the identity of the author, but the focus remains on the content and its impact. Students and researchers are inspired by the detailed accounts, and your work becomes a cornerstone for those studying women in computing. </p> <p> You feel a quiet satisfaction in knowing your story has helped shape history, even if your name never appears in the record books. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Anonymous and pseudonymous contributions have often shaped the historical record, especially for marginalized groups who faced barriers to recognition. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Support other anonymous contributors in preserving their stories->Ava Scene 8BO]]</li> <li>[[Leave instructions for your identity to be revealed after your passing->Ava Scene 8BP]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AO --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>National Celebration</h2> <p> You help organize a national celebration of women in technology, bringing together pioneers, students, and advocates from across the country. The videos are shared widely, used in classrooms and online courses. </p> <p> You receive messages from viewers around the world, many of whom say your story gave them the confidence to pursue their own STEM dreams. </p> <p> Your voice continues to inspire, even in places you may never visit in person. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Video storytelling and digital education platforms are powerful tools for sharing women’s STEM stories globally. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: eniacprogrammers.org; Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Collaborate with educators to develop lesson plans->Ava Scene 8CA]]</li> <li>[[Feature other women’s stories in your series->Ava Scene 8CB]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AU --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Launching a National Campaign</h2> <p> You help launch a national campaign for women in STEM, working with advocacy groups, schools, and tech companies. The campaign features social media challenges, scholarships, and a series of high-profile events. </p> <p> As the campaign gains traction, stories from women across the country are shared and celebrated. More girls sign up for STEM programs, and companies begin to reevaluate their hiring and mentorship practices. </p> <p> You see real change happening and know your efforts have helped create a more inclusive and supportive environment for future generations. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> National campaigns and public advocacy are key drivers of policy change and cultural shifts in STEM fields. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Million Women Mentors; Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Organize a national STEM day of action->Ava Scene 8CC]]</li> <li>[[Create a toolkit for local organizers->Ava Scene 8CD]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AV --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Mentoring Storytellers</h2> <p> You dedicate time to mentoring a new generation of storytellers in STEM. Through workshops, webinars, and one-on-one coaching, you help women and girls find their voices and share their journeys. </p> <p> Your mentees go on to publish blog posts, produce podcasts, and even write books about their experiences. The network of storytellers grows, amplifying the impact of women’s voices in science and technology. </p> <p> You’re proud to see how storytelling can drive change and foster a sense of belonging in the STEM community. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Storytelling and personal narrative are powerful tools for advocacy and community-building in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM Mentorship Program; All Together</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a storytelling festival for women in STEM->Ava Scene 8CE]]</li> <li>[[Collaborate with a publishing house for a women-in-tech anthology->Ava Scene 8CF]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AW --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Mentoring Circles Conference</h2> <p> You help organize a conference for mentoring circles, bringing together participants from across the country. The event is filled with workshops, networking sessions, and inspiring keynote speakers. </p> <p> Attendees share stories of how mentoring has changed their careers and lives. New circles form, and plans are made for ongoing collaboration and support. </p> <p> You realize that collective mentorship can create a ripple effect, empowering hundreds of women and girls to pursue their dreams. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Mentoring circles and peer networks are proven to increase retention and advancement for women in STEM fields. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Publish a guide on creating effective mentoring circles->Ava Scene 8CG]]</li> <li>[[Nominate successful circles for national recognition->Ava Scene 8CH]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 7AX --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>National Tech Awards</h2> <p> You nominate your mentees for a national tech award, highlighting their achievements and the impact of their projects. Students are excited to share their discoveries, and the school creates a permanent display honoring these unsung innovators. </p> <p> You see the pride in their eyes and know you’ve helped spark a lifelong curiosity for history and justice. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Student-driven research projects are a powerful way to connect young people to history and foster critical thinking skills. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. You connect with universities, tech companies, and advocacy groups to recruit mentors and mentees from all backgrounds. </p> <p> The program grows rapidly, with hundreds of women across the country participating in workshops, webinars, and one-on-one sessions. You see mentees gain confidence and mentors rediscover their passion for guiding others. </p> <p> You realize that mentorship is a powerful force for change, breaking down barriers and building bridges between generations. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> National mentorship initiatives have been shown to increase retention, advancement, and satisfaction among women in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM Mentorship Program; Million Women Mentors</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a national mentorship summit->Ava Scene 9Q]]</li> <li>[[Develop a mentorship toolkit for schools and companies->Ava Scene 9R]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8J --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Travelogue of Inspiration</h2> <p> You decide to write a travelogue about your experiences visiting schools, conferences, and STEM events across the country. Each chapter highlights the people you’ve met and the stories that have inspired you. </p> <p> The book is filled with anecdotes, photos, and reflections on the power of community and the importance of visibility for women in technology. Readers are moved by your honesty and humor. </p> <p> Your travelogue becomes a resource for educators and advocates, showing how one person’s journey can spark change in every corner of the nation. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Personal narratives and travelogues are powerful ways to document and share the impact of outreach and advocacy in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Share your travelogue at a national book festival->Ava Scene 9S]]</li> <li>[[Publish excerpts in STEM magazines->Ava Scene 9T]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8K --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Mentorship Circles Multiply</h2> <p> Your mentees are inspired to start their own mentorship circles, expanding the network you began. Each new group brings together women from different backgrounds, sharing advice and support. </p> <p> The circles connect online and in person, hosting regular meetings and workshops. As the network grows, you see a new generation of leaders emerge, confident and empowered. </p> <p> You are proud to see your mentorship ripple outward, creating a legacy of support and solidarity in STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Peer mentorship circles are proven to boost confidence, retention, and leadership among women in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a national summit for mentorship circles->Ava Scene 9U]]</li> <li>[[Publish a guidebook on starting mentorship circles->Ava Scene 9V]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8L --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>National Recognition for Mentees</h2> <p> You nominate your mentees for a national award in technology. Several are selected as finalists, and the ceremony is broadcast live. Watching them accept their awards, you feel immense pride. </p> <p> The recognition opens doors for your mentees, giving them opportunities to lead new projects and inspire others. They thank you for your unwavering support and guidance. </p> <p> You see your legacy reflected in their achievements, knowing you have helped shape the future of women in STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> National awards and recognition help boost the careers and visibility of women in science and technology. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: eniacprogrammers.org; Million Women Mentors</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Help your mentees start their own mentorship programs->Ava Scene 9W]]</li> <li>[[Write a feature article about their journeys->Ava Scene 9X]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8M --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>STEM Fair for Girls</h2> <p> You organize a city-wide STEM fair focused on girls’ participation. As you speak, you recall the emotions of your journey—the excitement of discovery, the frustration of being overlooked, and the pride in your accomplishments. </p> <p> The audiobook is made freely available online and through libraries. Listeners from all walks of life reach out to share how your voice brought history to life for them, making your story accessible to those who prefer or need audio. </p> <p> You are moved by the messages from students, teachers, and lifelong learners who say your story inspired them to pursue their own dreams in science and technology. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Audiobooks and podcasts have become powerful tools for sharing the stories of women in STEM, making them accessible to wider and more diverse audiences. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: eniacprogrammers.org; Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Start a podcast series on women in computing->Ava Scene 9AY]]</li> <li>[[Collaborate with educators to use your audio memoir in classrooms->Ava Scene 9AZ]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AA --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>University Archive Donation</h2> <p> You donate your personal papers, journals, and memorabilia to a university archive. Archivists are thrilled, and your collection becomes a valuable resource for researchers and students. </p> <p> The university hosts an exhibit featuring your work, and you’re invited to speak at the opening. Students and faculty are eager to learn from your firsthand accounts of early computing. </p> <p> You feel a sense of fulfillment, knowing your legacy will be preserved and studied for generations to come. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> University archives and museums have become important repositories for the personal papers and artifacts of women in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Mentor students interested in archival research->Ava Scene 9BA]]</li> <li>[[Help curate future STEM exhibits at the archive->Ava Scene 9BB]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AB --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Sharing with Family</h2> <p> You share your memoir and personal archives with your family, passing down your story to children and grandchildren. They listen with fascination and pride, asking questions about your work and the world you helped shape. </p> <p> Family gatherings become opportunities to share memories and lessons, and your descendants grow up knowing the value of perseverance, curiosity, and courage. </p> <p> You realize that family is the first and most important audience for your legacy, and you are grateful to see your story live on through them. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Family storytelling and personal archives are crucial for preserving the histories of women in STEM, especially when public recognition is limited. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Encourage your grandchildren to pursue STEM->Ava Scene 9BC]]</li> <li>[[Help a family member start a STEM project or club->Ava Scene 9BD]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AC --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Community Reading Challenge</h2> <p> You launch a statewide reading challenge, encouraging students and families to read your memoir and other books about women in STEM. Libraries and schools participate, hosting events and discussions. </p> <p> The challenge sparks excitement and friendly competition, with prizes for the most books read and the best essays or projects inspired by the stories. </p> <p> You see the impact of your story multiply, as more people discover the hidden histories that shaped the digital age. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Reading challenges and book clubs are effective ways to promote literacy, community engagement, and interest in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a virtual author Q&A for participants->Ava Scene 9BE]]</li> <li>[[Publish a collection of student essays and reviews->Ava Scene 9BF]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AD --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Community Storytelling Events</h2> <p> Inspired by the success of your library reading, you encourage others to organize their own storytelling events. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Start a book club for women in STEM->Ava Scene 9CC]]</li> <li>[[Encourage students to create their own memoir projects->Ava Scene 9CD]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AP --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Inspiring Others to Donate</h2> <p> You encourage others in your community to donate their stories, papers, and artifacts to local libraries and archives. You help organize an information session, inviting archivists to explain the process and its importance. </p> <p> Soon, the library’s collection grows with new voices and perspectives, reflecting the diversity and richness of your community’s history. </p> <p> You are proud to see a new tradition take root, ensuring that the stories of everyday innovators are preserved for future generations. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Community-driven archival donations help ensure that history is inclusive and representative of all who contributed. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Launch an annual archive donation drive->Ava Scene 9CE]]</li> <li>[[Create a digital archive for community stories->Ava Scene 9CF]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AQ --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Blogging for Change</h2> <p> You start a blog dedicated to women in computing, sharing your own stories and inviting guest posts from students, colleagues, and other trailblazers. The blog quickly attracts a loyal readership, sparking conversations and collaborations. </p> <p> Readers from around the world comment on your posts, sharing their experiences and asking for advice. Your blog becomes a platform for advocacy, mentorship, and celebration of women’s achievements in technology. </p> <p> You are amazed by the connections you make and the impact your words have, knowing your digital voice is inspiring change far beyond your hometown. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Blogs and digital storytelling platforms are powerful tools for advocacy, community-building, and preserving women’s voices in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Launch a guest blog series for women in STEM->Ava Scene 9CG]]</li> <li>[[Collaborate with international bloggers for a global campaign->Ava Scene 9CH]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AR --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Digital Archive Collaboration</h2> <p> You collaborate with digital historians to create an online archive dedicated to women in technology. The archive features oral histories, scanned documents, and interactive timelines. </p> <p> Contributors from around the world add their stories, making the archive a living, growing resource for researchers, educators, and students. </p> <p> You are proud to see your legacy preserved alongside so many others, ensuring that the achievements of women in STEM are never forgotten. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Digital archives are transforming how we preserve, access, and share the stories of women and minorities in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a virtual launch event for the archive->Ava Scene 9CI]]</li> <li>[[Develop educational modules using archive resources->Ava Scene 9CJ]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AS --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Statewide Reading Challenge</h2> <p> You organize a statewide reading challenge, encouraging students and families to read memoirs and stories of women in STEM. Libraries and schools host events, and readers share reviews and reflections online. </p> <p> The challenge sparks friendly competition and brings communities together. You’re invited to visit schools and participate in discussions, inspiring even more readers to join. </p> <p> You see the ripple effect of your story as new generations are inspired to explore, learn, and dream. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Reading challenges and book clubs are effective ways to promote literacy, community engagement, and interest in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Publish a collection of student essays and reviews->Ava Scene 9CK]]</li> <li>[[Host a virtual author Q&A for participants->Ava Scene 9CL]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AT --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Celebrating with Family and Colleagues</h2> <p> After the dedication ceremony, you gather with family and colleagues to celebrate. Your colleagues reminisce about the challenges you faced and the victories you achieved. </p> <p> Surrounded by loved ones, you feel a deep sense of fulfillment, knowing your legacy is both public and personal. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Family and community celebrations help reinforce the importance of women’s achievements and inspire future generations to pursue their passions. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Together, you visit science museums, experiment with coding games, and talk about the women who changed the world through STEM. </p> <p> Over time, your grandchild’s curiosity blossoms into ambition. She joins a STEM club at school, participates in robotics competitions, and dreams of becoming an engineer—carrying your legacy forward. </p> <p> You realize that by empowering your family, you’re helping to close the gender gap in STEM, one dream at a time. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Family encouragement and early exposure to STEM role models are critical factors in inspiring girls to pursue science and technology careers. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: National Girls Collaborative Project; Girls Who Code; Teach For All</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Help your grandchild start a STEM project or club->Ava Scene 9CO]]</li> <li>[[Write letters to encourage her journey->Ava Scene 9CP]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AV --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Writing a Family Memoir</h2> <p> Inspired by your grandchild’s interest, you begin writing a family memoir. You weave together stories of your work on ENIAC, your family’s journey, and the changing world of technology. </p> <p> The memoir becomes a treasured keepsake, passed down through generations. Family members add their own chapters, creating a living document of resilience, curiosity, and achievement. </p> <p> You are proud to see your story spark new dreams and remind your family—and future readers—that women have always belonged in STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Family memoirs and intergenerational storytelling are powerful ways to inspire girls to pursue STEM and to preserve women’s contributions for the future. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: National Center for Women & Information Technology; UNESCO; Teach For All</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Donate a copy of your memoir to a local library->Ava Scene 9CQ]]</li> <li>[[Organize a family storytelling night->Ava Scene 9CR]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AW --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Statewide Reading Challenge</h2> <p> You help organize a statewide reading challenge, encouraging students and families to read memoirs and stories of women in STEM. Libraries and schools participate, hosting events and discussions that bring communities together. </p> <p> Readers share reviews, essays, and artwork inspired by the stories they discover. The guide includes discussion prompts, project ideas, and biographies of trailblazing women scientists and engineers. </p> <p> Teachers across the state use the guide to spark classroom conversations about perseverance, discovery, and the importance of representation. Students are encouraged to research and present on their own STEM heroes. </p> <p> You see the guide’s impact as more girls raise their hands in science class and dream bigger about their futures. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Classroom resources and lesson plans that highlight women’s achievements in STEM help close the gender gap and foster a sense of belonging for all students. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Kids Discover; Post University; White House Women in STEM</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Hold a teacher training workshop on inclusive STEM education->Ava Scene 9CM]]</li> <li>[[Invite students to create their own STEM storybooks->Ava Scene 9CN]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AY --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Launching a STEM Podcast</h2> <p> You launch a podcast series on women in computing, interviewing pioneers, educators, and rising stars. Each episode features stories of resilience, innovation, and the importance of mentorship and community. </p> <p> Listeners from around the world tune in, sharing how the podcast inspired them to pursue STEM or support girls in their own communities. You receive messages from teachers who use the episodes in their classrooms. </p> <p> You are reminded how storytelling—especially through accessible media—can break down barriers and build a more inclusive future for science and technology. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Podcasts and audio storytelling make women’s achievements in STEM accessible to a global audience and inspire the next generation. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: I Play Like a Girl; Post University; Kids Discover</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Invite students to submit their own podcast episodes->Ava Scene 9CO]]</li> <li>[[Feature international STEM role models in future episodes->Ava Scene 9CP]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8AZ --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Audio Memoir in Classrooms</h2> <p> You collaborate with educators to bring your audio memoir into classrooms as part of the curriculum. Teachers use your story to introduce students to the history of women in STEM and to spark discussions about perseverance and innovation. </p> <p> Students listen to your voice and reflect on the obstacles and breakthroughs that shaped your journey. The event is filled with friendly rivalry, creative problem-solving, and plenty of encouragement. </p> <p> Parents and teachers cheer as students tackle challenging puzzles and work together in teams. The winners are celebrated, but every participant leaves with new skills and a sense of accomplishment. </p> <p> You are thrilled to see so many young people excited about math, and you know your efforts are helping to change the narrative around who belongs in STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Math competitions and collaborative problem-solving events help boost confidence, teamwork, and interest in STEM for all students. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: National Girls Collaborative Project; MathCounts Foundation</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Expand the competition to include coding challenges->Ava Scene 9CU]]</li> <li>[[Publish a booklet of creative math problems from the event->Ava Scene 9CV]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BC --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>School Reading Event</h2> <p> You host a reading of your children’s book at a local school. Teachers use the comics to introduce STEM concepts and to show that scientists and engineers can be anyone. </p> <p> You are thrilled to see your work reach new audiences, making STEM accessible and fun for all. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Comics and graphic novels are effective tools for engaging reluctant readers and introducing complex STEM topics in an approachable way. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Kids Discover; padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Online Mentorship Platform</h2> <p> You help develop an online mentorship platform, connecting students and mentors from across the country. The platform offers resources, discussion forums, and virtual events. </p> <p> Mentees find support and guidance at every stage of their STEM journey, and mentors are able to share their expertise and encouragement with a wider audience. </p> <p> You are excited to see technology used to break down barriers and make mentorship accessible to all. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Online mentorship platforms increase access to support and opportunities for students in rural, underserved, or marginalized communities. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Million Women Mentors; National Girls Collaborative Project</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a national virtual mentorship summit->Ava Scene 9DC]]</li> <li>[[Invite international mentors to join the platform->Ava Scene 9DD]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BG --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Anthology Launch Event</h2> <p> You host a launch event for your anthology of women’s stories in STEM. Contributors, students, and community members gather to celebrate, share readings, and discuss the importance of diverse voices in science and technology. </p> <p> The event is filled with laughter, applause, and moments of deep connection. Readers and writers alike are inspired to continue sharing their journeys and supporting one another. </p> <p> You realize that every story told is a step toward a more inclusive and vibrant STEM community. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Book launches and community readings help amplify underrepresented voices and foster networks of support in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Light, "When Computers Were Women"</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Partner with local schools to use the anthology in class->Ava Scene 9DE]]</li> <li>[[Organize a writing contest for young women in STEM->Ava Scene 9DF]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BH --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Anthology in the Classroom</h2> <p> You partner with teachers to incorporate your anthology into school curricula. Students read the essays, discuss the challenges and triumphs of women in STEM, and reflect on their own aspirations. </p> <p> The anthology sparks lively classroom discussions and inspires students to research and write about their own STEM heroes. Teachers report increased engagement and a greater sense of belonging among girls and underrepresented students. </p> <p> You are proud to see your work shape the next generation’s understanding of science, technology, and the importance of diverse voices. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Inclusive classroom materials and diverse role models help close achievement gaps and foster a sense of belonging in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Kids Discover; National Girls Collaborative Project</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a student panel discussion about the anthology->Ava Scene 9DG]]</li> <li>[[Publish a companion guide for teachers->Ava Scene 9DH]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BI --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Mentorship Network Launch</h2> <p> Building on the success of your advocacy summit, you help launch a nationwide mentorship network. Women in STEM from all backgrounds sign up to mentor, learn, and connect. </p> <p> The network hosts webinars, Q&A sessions, and virtual meetups, creating a vibrant community of support and opportunity. Mentees share stories of breakthroughs and new friendships. </p> <p> You are thrilled to see your vision for a more connected and inclusive STEM world come to life. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Mentorship networks have been shown to increase retention, advancement, and satisfaction among women in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Million Women Mentors; National Girls Collaborative Project</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a virtual mentorship summit->Ava Scene 9DI]]</li> <li>[[Develop a toolkit for new mentors->Ava Scene 9DJ]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BJ --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Publishing an Advocacy Toolkit</h2> <p> You compile the lessons and strategies from your advocacy summit into a toolkit for young leaders. The project is shared widely and becomes a source of inspiration for students and professionals alike. </p> <p> Readers add their own letters, stories, and reflections, growing the chain into a global network of support. </p> <p> You are moved by the impact of your simple idea, knowing it will empower countless women to find their voices and lift each other up. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Digital mentorship chains and letter-writing campaigns help build community, resilience, and a sense of belonging in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: National Girls Collaborative Project; Women in STEM: The Importance of Mentorship and Community</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Host a virtual reading of the mentorship chain->Ava Scene 9DM]]</li> <li>[[Encourage schools to use the letters in their programs->Ava Scene 9DN]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BL --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Presenting at a Leadership Summit</h2> <p> You present the mentorship chain project at a women’s leadership summit, sharing its origins and the impact it has had on participants. The interview is recorded and made available to researchers and students. </p> <p> Listening to your own voice, you are struck by how far you’ve come—and how much your story can teach others about perseverance, creativity, and change. </p> <p> You are grateful for the opportunity to leave a personal record for future generations. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Oral history interviews are invaluable resources for historians, educators, and students studying women in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. You share your experience through blog posts and at community events, offering guidance and reassurance. </p> <p> Gradually, more women step into the light, adding their names to the record and inspiring others to do the same. The archive grows richer and more complete with every new voice. </p> <p> You feel immense satisfaction, knowing you have helped others find the courage to be seen and celebrated. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Public recognition and personal storytelling help ensure that women’s contributions to STEM are properly credited and remembered. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Jennifer S. Through workshops and online forums, you provide guidance on documenting experiences, sharing safely, and connecting with supportive communities. </p> <p> As more women come forward—sometimes anonymously, sometimes by name—the archive grows richer and more representative. You witness the relief and pride that comes from finally having one’s story valued. </p> <p> You know that every voice, named or unnamed, helps build a more complete and inclusive history of women in STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Mentorship and peer support are vital for encouraging women to share their stories and persist in STEM, whether publicly or anonymously. Archivists and historians prepare a special exhibit, unveiling the author behind the influential notes and memoirs. </p> <p> The news inspires a new wave of research and storytelling. Students and community members celebrate your courage, and your family beams with pride as your legacy is honored publicly. </p> <p> You have shown that every contribution matters, and that sometimes, the right moment for recognition comes when the world is ready to listen. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> Many women in STEM choose when and how to reveal their stories. The summit becomes an annual tradition, growing in size and impact each year. </p> <p> You are proud to see your mentees take the lead, knowing you have helped prepare them to shape the future of STEM. </p> <div class="fact-box"> <strong>Did you know?</strong> National summits and conferences foster leadership, collaboration, and innovation among women and girls in STEM. <br><span style="font-style: italic;">Source: Million Women Mentors; Women in STEM Mentorship Program</span> </div> <ul> <li>[[Publish a guidebook on organizing advocacy events->Ava Scene 9EA]]</li> <li>[[Create a mentorship network for summit alumni->Ava Scene 9EB]]</li> </ul> </div> <!-- Title: Ava Scene 8BT --> <style> .story-scene { background: rgba(0,0,0,0.45); padding: 32px; border-radius: 15px; max-width: 650px; margin: 40px auto 0 auto; color: #e0e0e0; box-shadow: 0 0 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.3); } .story-scene h2 { color: #b3e0ff; margin-bottom: 18px; font-size: 26px; } .story-scene p { margin-bottom: 10px; line-height: 1.6; font-size: 18px; } .fact-box { background: rgba(0,212,255,0.13); border-left: 4px solid #00d2ff; color: #b3e0ff; padding: 10px 20px; margin: 18px 0; font-size: 16px; border-radius: 8px; } </style> <div class="story-scene"> <h2>Writing an Advocacy Guidebook</h2> <p> You write a guidebook for young leaders in STEM advocacy, drawing on your experience and the lessons learned from your mentees.
